“You ready?” You ask.

“As I'll ever be.” Aelriss readies her staff. “Wait for Eunoia to turn.”

“I'm going after it takes a swing.” You respond.

It makes no sound beyond the snapping of fallen trees underfoot as it pushes through the brush; violet bursts of distant lightning occasionally illuminate the sky, casting an eerie glow over the washed-out colors of this simulation. The bird of paradise swoops upward and around in an arc, loosing tiny orange embers toward the crystals embedded in the frame, which crackle and explode, leaving impurities in its earthen body.

Aelriss moves up, holding her staff high like a flagbearer's standard before ducking beneath the construct's first swing and battering its ceramic-armored kneecaps. That's when you leap forward, blade wreathed in a field of twisting force.
